title: Aatrox - Released nearly two years - Has received only one major update which gutted him
body:
TL;DR - Aatrox two years since release, nerfed once, absolute garbage champion. I'm not about to give up on him yet just because Riot most recently gave Aatrox a minor QoL change that doesn't change anything. The windows for feeling strong as Aatrox feel so very limited, and his early-mid game isn't strong enough to justify how absolutely awful his late game is.

**Riot on Aatrox**

To my recollection, there are two instances where Riot has acknowledged Aatrox in the forums after his one update: One by Morello and another by Meddler.

Morello

02-18-2014

http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?p=45244229#45244229

>     We made some big game health mistakes on Aatrox that put him in a problematic spot - there's accuracy in the fact that if he's buffed, he'll be a problem.
> 
>     We've had some Aatrox changes to solve this (as a soft rework sorta thing) that could fix this, and then let him get back into the game. I'll have to check on the details to see which direction we've taken with it (there were a lot of ideas on the table for it, originally).

Meddler

12-26-2014

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/alR9fGRR-can-we-replace-aatroxs-ultimate-steroid-with-an-aoe-fear?comment=000c

Meddler's post is a lot larger, but to summarize: He agrees that Aatrox's ultimate isn't as satisfying and good as an ultimate should be, acknowledges that a PBAoE Fear addition to Aatrox's ult has at least some thematic reasoning behind it, remarks on Aatrox as a Tank vs Aatrox as a Fighter, and concludes that him posting isn't an indicator that there are upcoming Aatrox changes and that Aatrox is "overall in an ok spot." Apparently the rest of the Riot team who works on gameplay and balance agree with those sentiments as Aatrox has received only one significant change (the aforementioned) since his release. It's been one whole year since Morello mentioned "some Aatrox changes" and nothing has really come of it. As it is now, Aatrox suffers from terrible base stats, terrible scaling/late game (AP ratio on his ultimate?), very low impact and unsatisfying ultimate (backed by Meddler), getting kited too easily, bad 5v5 teamfights, and a bunch of other things like how his sustain is minion dependent (IOW no minions or zoned from CS = no sustain).

**Comparison of Aatrox/Rek'sai as junglers **
On other social media, I posted a comparison of two top tier junglers of different eras (season 3 and season 5) in Aatrox and Rek'sai. These are supposed to be two "Fighters" as Riot classifies them, while Aatrox's secondary is "Tank". Rek'sai has no secondary. Keep in mind that Rek'Sai's base stats are better overall - she has far better health, health regen, longer base AA range, and better armor than Aatrox. Aatrox has negligibly better AD, negligibly better AS, and negligibly better move speed. Rek'sai is also the only current jungler who isn't straight up a tank who can scale decently well as a tank late game with cinderhulk.

Rek'Sai has easily far more mobility, far better clears, much lower cooldowns (which leads to a lot of things like more knock-ups, more damage, etc.), relevant damage at all points of the game thanks to true damage (vs Aatrox who falls off mid-late), better base stats, a much more reliable/larger knock-up that is much easier to land (this + her mobility translates into better/more ganks), and far more utility, and transitions to a late game tank way better than Aatrox.

Aatrox has a free GA, potentially better prolonged sustain, a metric ton more AS, and a slow-moving small AoE skillshot that slows, and potentially more mixed damage early on (his magic damage because negligible mid-late). Other than that, Aatrox is split between either sustain or damage (remember, one or the other on the third auto vs Rek'Sai who gets an auto attack reset - something that Aatrox, an AA based champion, lacks) and is worse in basically every other regard to Rek'Sai. Additionally, Aatrox has to kill himself to keep his resource bar up and loses 15% of his current health with Q+E (1500 gold worth of stats at level 18 with Randuins/Spirit Visage/Warmogs) while Rek'Sai's stats are 100% free.

So Riot, can Aatrox get his rework already or some ACTUAL changes? One QoL change to his ult doesn't change anything.

Long term we'd still like to do some significant work to Aatrox, take advantage of his theme more and make him a champion with more distinct gameplay. That's not currently a scheduled project though, there are other champs we feel need the work more.

We don't want to just leave him as is for an indeterminate period of time however. In the short term as a result we're going to be buffing his passive so its cooldown reduces by level. I'd really like to see his ultimate become a better tool. The attack range and attack speed steroid is cool and all for him, but throughout the huge lore buildup for him and his role as a Darkin who comes to change the tide of battle and inspire the side he's fighting for, he's really not come through in any way on that. Some sort of buff to his team would really fit his lore and also make him a worthwhile pick even when he is forced to build supremely tanky and just initiate fights with his ridiculously long cast time Q.

Hell, make the buff only affect his team and not himself if you're concerned with the ramifications on a carry-built Aatrox. He already gets his own steroids from it, perhaps extend these to his allies. There are tons of options!

* Give his allies the same attack range/attack speed steroid. Short and sweet, although it could be a little broken when factoring the range of champions like Tristana/Caitlyn/Kog'maw and their ability to work around tower pushing with this. Perhaps attack range for melee and attack speed for ranged?
* Use his Blood Well on the first ally to die while his ultimate is activated instead of keeping it for himself; this would provide windows of opportunity for team fighting but also keep the enemy team knowledgeable about when it is available for strong counterplay options!
* Give something similar to the current Zeke's Herald buff to his teammates; a temporary AD/AP and Lifesteal/Spell Vamp aura around him as he bolsters his allies in battle. May infringe into Taric's territory, but Taric is up for a rework last I heard and he really needs to be worked on even more than Aatrox probably.
* Some sort of damage on hit buff for his team; similar to how Ardent Censer now gives magic damage on hit to his allies, have him do the same thing. Blue elixir-ish maybe, where it has a slight true damage proc that is on a cooldown against champions to not become overbearing?

I love Aatrox, I love my Mecha Aatrox, and I'd love to see him become more useable in the current meta where a fighter type champion is left in the "Rejected" bin because tanks and even bruisers building tanky are going to outscale him and be more useful to the team in the late game. If you attempt to build Aatrox this way, you just become a walking meatshield that uses his own health to cast spells; you're occupying the same space in the game as Zac, but Zac has more CC available in his kit as well as percent health damage which can contribute to tank busting in this tank-filled world we live in right now.

Give us what we need in this Darkin champion! Give us the character he was built up to be, someone to rally the troops when they're down and inspire them to crush their foes before them and seek victory in the darkest hour!

What really, really, really bothers me about Aatrox is how far from his core identity. He's supposed to be this bathed in blood warrior who can turn the tide of battle. In early PBE, he had that, with the buffs that he could give his teammates.
After a few PBE patches, the war monster that was sold to us as Aatorx was no more. What we have now is a champion that completely revolves around self-buffing, and creates a really binary playstyle. In my humble opinion, as a rather frequent Aatrox player, is that Riot needs to give Aatrox a complete kit rework. Number tweaks might put him back into viability, but won't remove the binary abomination that Aatrox has become.
I would love to see him become a team buffing fighter, sorta like GP currently is with his E, but, of course with more team buffs.
That's just my opinion though, and of course, what I see as core identity may be different for others
